alert.note: Alert for San Benito; Santa Clara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 12:39PM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .The Pacheco Creek near Dunneville is expected to remain above flood stage through Saturday morning. Water rescues have taken place at Lover`s Lane. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, San Benito. In northern California, Santa Clara. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 PM PST, The Pacheco Creek near Dunneville is expected to remain above flood stage through Saturday morning. Water rescues have taken place at Lover`s Lane. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northern San Benito and Southeastern Santa Clara Counties - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
